question.text: Which one is the most likely structure of CrCl<sub>3</sub> .6H<sub>2</sub>O, if 1/3 of total chlorine of the compound is precipitated by adding AgNO<sub>3</sub> to its aqueous solution?

options.text: <math><mrow>  <mfenced open="[" close="]" separators=",">    <mrow>      <mtext>Cr</mtext>      <msub>            <mrow>              <mfenced open="(" close=")" separators=",">                <mrow>                  <msub>                          <mtext>H</mtext>                        <mn>2</mn>                  </msub>                  <mtext>O</mtext>                </mrow>              </mfenced>            </mrow>            <mn>3</mn>      </msub>      <msub>              <mtext>Cl</mtext>            <mn>3</mn>      </msub>    </mrow>  </mfenced>  <mo>·</mo>  <mn>3</mn>  <msub>          <mtext>H</mtext>        <mn>2</mn>  </msub>  <mtext>O</mtext></mrow></math>

<math> <mrow> <mfenced close="]" open="[" separators=","> <mrow> <mtext>Cr</mtext> <msub> <mtext>Cl</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <msub> <mrow> <mfenced close=")" open="(" separators=","> <mrow> <msub> <mtext>H</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mtext>O</mtext> </mrow> </mfenced> </mrow> <mn>4</mn> </msub> </mrow> </mfenced> <mtext>Cl</mtext> <mo>·</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mtext>H</mtext> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mtext>O</mtext> </mrow> </math>

<math><mrow>  <mfenced open="[" close="]" separators=",">    <mrow>      <mtext>Cr</mtext>                <mtext>Cl</mtext>            <msub>            <mrow>              <mfenced open="(" close=")" separators=",">                <mrow>                  <msub>                          <mtext>H</mtext>                        <mn>2</mn>                  </msub>                  <mtext>O</mtext>                </mrow>              </mfenced>            </mrow>            <mn>5</mn>      </msub>    </mrow>  </mfenced>  <msub>          <mtext>Cl</mtext>        <mn>2</mn>  </msub>  <mo>·</mo>  <msub>          <mtext>H</mtext>        <mn>2</mn>  </msub>  <mtext>O</mtext></mrow></math>

solution.text:
CrCl 3 · 6 H 2 O has 3−Cl atoms but 1 3 Cl atoms precipitated so one 1 Cl atom get precipitated.

According to Werner's theory, only those ions are precipitated which are attached to the metal atoms with ionic bonds and are present outside the co-ordination sphere.

Cr H 2 O 4 Cl 2 Cl (aq)⇌    Cr H 2 O 4 Cl 2 + aq + Cl − aq

  Ag++Cl- ⟶AgCl ↓white
